reviews.review_msg: She barely turned up for class. Instead, she left us in the hands of a TA who admitted that she knew nothing about the subject of the class. O'Neil never even returned our massive portfolio project, worth 60% of our grade, so although we got a mark (which was submitted to the university the same day we submitted it to her), we never got feedback.

Susan is very passionate about her topic - Positive Youth Development. She practices it with her students as well, and the class is shaped around that. It's a bit heavy reading, tough assignments if you miss a class, but the course project was a great experience and a lot of fun (put readings to  use). Lots of participation, but easy marker in all.
Super boring and difficult. Readings made zero sense and assignments (25% each) worth marked unbelievably hard. GPA plunker

Awesome prof. Super helpful, very friendly and interested in her students. Class feels like a family near the end. The assignments are not very clear, but they are worth doing because you really do learn a lot.
